articles.summary: Bitcoin surged past $105,000 on Monday, extending gains to trade near $106,000 as optimism over the U.S. government's shutdown resolution revived risk appetite across global markets. Reports of a Senate breakthrough to fund key departments and reopen government operations triggered a wave of investor relief.

articles.title: Stablecoin Supply Begins to Shrink As Bitcoin Reclaims $105K: Liquidity Cooling?
articles.author: Bitcoinist
articles.summary: Bitcoin (BTC) is staging a recovery after a sharp decline that briefly pushed prices below the $100,000 mark. BTC has since bounced back, trading above $105,000 as investors eye potential relief from the looming U.S. financial crisis.

articles.title: Institutional Crypto Adoption Soars as Biopharma Giant Secures $100M for Digital Assets
articles.author: Bitcoin World
articles.summary: Propanc Biopharma has secured up to $100 million for cryptocurrency purchases. This is one of the most significant entry into the digital asset space by a publicly-traded biopharmaceutical company into the crypto space. It signals growing institutional crypto adoption.

articles.title: South Korean model Han Hye-jin's channel hacked and deleted after cryptocurrency live broadcast
articles.author: The Times
articles.summary: Han Hye-jin's official channel was hacked by hackers on the morning of. She has 860,000 followers and is known for sharing her daily life and entertainment content with her followers on her channel and social media platforms. She is currently unharmed.

articles.title: Matrixport: Bitcoin's $105K rebound remains to be tested
articles.author: BTC Manager
articles.summary: Matrixport analysts say Bitcoin's recent rebound back to $105,000 remains to be the best hope for Bitcoin's future price recovery.    The Bitcoin's price is still below $100,000, according to Matrixport's analysts, and it's unlikely to recover.

It is called The Philippine Blockade Infrastructure Council.

articles.title: Here Are The Bitcoin Whales That Have Been Dumping BTC And Crashing The Price

The entire market sentiment is somewhat fragile following heavy selling pressure from large holders. On-chain data points to major whale movements that may be adding to the downtrend.

articles.title: Bitcoin at critical test: If BTC breaks above $106k, bear market could be postponed
articles.author: Cryptoslate
articles.summary: Bitcoin is back at $106,400, a pivot point that has been critical to this cycle's rallies and pullbacks. Acceptance above this band has tended to unlock the next level. Rejection has forced a rebuild below a fair-value axis.

articles.title: Bitcoin is up as shutdown clouds begin to clear
articles.author: Bit RSS
articles.summary: The Senate advanced a bipartisan funding package aimed at ending the shutdown. Bitcoin rose from its $100K bottom to its $1,000K level after the Senate passed the bill.    Bitcoin's value rose from $100,000 to $1.000K.

articles.title: Donald Trump Is Giving Out $2,000 To Americans, Here's What Happened To Bitcoin The Last ...
articles.author: Bitcoinist
articles.summary: Donald Trump announced plans to give out $2,000 to American citizens. Analysts are debating how this influx of cash could impact Bitcoin (BTC). The last time the US government initiated direct cash payments to citizens, it ignited a massive BTC rally. Now analysts are wondering if it will happen again.

articles.title: Bybit Eyes South Korean Expansion with Korbit Acquisition

articles.summary: Bybit is rumoured to be interested in the acquisition of Korbit, South Korea's fourth-largest cryptocurrency exchange. No official announcement has been made concerning the matter yet. Bybit will start with SK Planet's stake in the exchange, according to reports.
